Fluoxetine.name: Fluoxetine
warnings: May increase risk of suicidal thoughts, especially in children and young adults.
Risk of serotonin syndrome when used with other serotonergic drugs (e.g., triptans, MAOIs, tramadol).
Do not use with or within 14 days of MAO inhibitors.
May cause insomnia, agitation, or anxiety in some patients.
Use with caution in patients with a history of seizures (epilepsy).
Use during pregnancy (especially in the third trimester) may affect the newborn.
Can pass into breast milk; consult your doctor if breastfeeding.
May increase risk of gastrointestinal bleeding, especially with NSAIDs or aspirin.
Dose adjustment may be needed in patients with liver impairment.
Do not stop suddenly; tapering is recommended to avoid withdrawal symptoms.
Fluoxetine.description: Fluoxetine is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) used primarily to treat major depressive disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder, bulimia nervosa, and panic disorder. It works by increasing the levels of serotonin in the brain, which can help improve mood, anxiety, and overall emotional well-being.
